title: Tap Turns on the Water
text:
"Tap Turns on the Water" is a song and <a href="single%20%28music%29">single</a> by British band, <a href="Collective%20Consciousness%20Society">C.C.S.</a>. Written by band leader <a href="Alexis%20Korner">Alexis Korner</a> and <a href="John%20Cameron%20%28musician%29">John Cameron</a>, it was first released in the UK in 1971.
Background and chart success.
The song was the third chart success by C.C.S. and their most successful. It reached number five in the <a href="UK%20Singles%20Chart">UK Singles Chart</a> in September 1971 and remained in the chart for 15 weeks.
The song was choreographed for BBC dance troupe <a href="Pan%27s%20People">Pan's People</a> at <a href="Kempton%20Park%20Steam%20Engines">Kempton Park</a> pumping station.
The lyrics for the song were also adapted to be used as a <a href="association%20football">football</a> song by the supporters of <a href="Bristol%20Rovers%20F.C.">Bristol Rovers</a>.
